meanings.definition: Conforming to a standard or set of standards.
meanings.sent1: The school implemented a standardized test to measure student progress.
meanings.sent2: The company uses standardized procedures to ensure quality control.
meanings.sent3: The standardized rules for the game made it fair for everyone to play.
meanings.sent4: Her handwriting was so neat and standardized, it looked like it came from a computer.
meanings.sent5: The standardized color-coding system made it easy to organize the files.

meanings.sent1: The company standardized its production process to increase efficiency.
meanings.sent2: She standardized the font across all documents for a professional look.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly standardized the way his cat meowed every morning.
meanings.sent4: The artist standardized his painting style to create a cohesive collection.
meanings.sent5: The chef standardized the recipe to ensure the dish tasted the same every time.

meanings.definition: Established as a model or example for comparison.
meanings.sent1: The standardized prototype was used to guide the production of the final product.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed a standardized exhibit showcasing different art movements.
meanings.sent3: The standardized fashion show featured outfits inspired by famous paintings.
meanings.sent4: Her speech became the standardized reference for public speaking techniques.
meanings.sent5: The standardized design became the inspiration for future architectural projects.
